result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Webster

records.addlTxt:
3:36 PM Cases called: 22CF323 & 22CF336 Defendant Patrick M Webster in court.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Patrick M Webster. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 in 22CF323: Possession of Methamphetamine and Count 3 in 22CF336: Criminal Damage to Property. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to an amended Count 4 in 22CF336: County Disorderly Conduct

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas. Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 4 in 22CF336 and orders costs.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement is filed with and accepted by the Court for Count 1in 22CF323 and Count 3 in 22CF336.

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. 
Jail credit 22CF323 2 days of jail credit.
Jail credit 22CF336 1 day of jail credit.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 14, 2025 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on July 14, 2025 at 09:30 am.
Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement - DAGP (signed)

(Cases 22CF323, 22CF336 are called at 9:52 AM) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick M Webster in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Patrick M Webster. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.

(9:44 AM cases 22CF323, 22CF336 called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patrick M Webster in court. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Patrick M Webster. 
Attorney Linzmeier advises has an offer and needs to discuss it with the defendant.
Attorney Linzmeier requests new date.
Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
